column5: Interested in the new BX minnow. Wondering if anyone in has seen it in stores in Canada. I want to see it first hand before buying.
nice    really like the colour of the bottom one
Sure looks like a smelt.
Cool. I'll be picking up the bottom one and the perch coloured one. Can't go wrong with a good perch minnow.
Certain lakes around here, that's really all I would use and always catch something.
I like the finishes.  Dang, more lures to add to the collection.  WR
Checkout some new lures i just got..the finish and detail are amazing.  AR Lures wood cranks from Japan     Can't leave out my fav. megabass.    Newest White Python
True, but I'll stick with Live Target for the closest thing to a smelt.
Looks like an x rap without fur.
If you see them in a store look close at the body design,they are designed too roll left to right when twitched,I have one but have not fished it yet,a very nice bait
Looks similar maybe (it is a minnow imitation after all) but it's balsa not hollow plastic.
Does it suspend or float?  Sounds like a killer early season pike bait.

KF, my fishing partner had a sample this fall. The minnow is rounder than an x-rap, kind of like an x-rap that gained a little weight lol, and as you mentioned, is balsa, so it floats. Very nice looking bait, I'll grab a couple for fishing the shallows next spring.
It floats, but you could doctor it just like the originals before the suspending husky jerks came out.
You don't catch fish, you just troll fish forums!  We know!!!!   LOL!
LMAO!  Did you mean in or out?

I bought a couple of Live Target smelt imitations a couple of years ago but since then, the smelt imitations no longer have the same colour as the one's I bought.  They are more brownish now.  The smelt in my area are bluish/purple....not brownish.
There is an X-rap Countdown scheduled to be released pretty soon [i think?] as well.  Really looking forward to that one.
Pretty sweet looking!......Although, I think that when rapala came out with the x-rap, they really out-did themselves!

must be all the frogs in the water over there. I've had one for three years and over a hundred fish, slightly faded but same colours and works like always.  I do upgrade the hooks every now and again.
Sounds like too much UV exposure maybe?  I picked one up shortly after they came out and I haven't noticed any colour fade/change.
My mistake. Although they have more smelt colours now then before. Sounds like the store isn't carrying all the selection?
Time to shop online.
